Reviews.Title: “Nice, Quiet Hotel. Not close to city centre of Rome”
Reviews.Author: TravelMountain
Reviews.Content: What can I add? It is a clean hotel in a pleasant surroundings. The hotel is located in a sort of a park north of the centre of Rome. If you don't have a car then don't stay here. There is a bus getting you to the centre.

Reviews.Title: “A convenient accommodation in the outskirt of the Capital”
Reviews.Author: Salvatore A
Reviews.Content: Fairly basic and pretty far from central Rome, but the place has many plusses: the main building is located in a very pleasant park, parking could not be easier and the rooms are comfortable and clean. Continental breakfast is basic too, but adequate. Given the room rates, the combination is excellent value for money. A suggestion: if you are driving and want to visit central Rome, use your car to go to the underground parking of "Via del Muro Torto" (underneath Villa Borghese, 2€/hour). From there you can exit in "Piazza di Spagne", right in the hart of the big city and, from there, you can reach most of the main attractions through public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: LovTravelOz
Reviews.Content: The room and service is alright but the location is really bad. We stayed 2 nights as part of the cosmos tours and there is no other guests except our tour group. On our last early morning, when we checkout, we met a group of policemen there from the South. After we found out that we had to catch 2 buses and a tram to the city, we gave up on the idea and look for a restaurant nearby. The hotel only provide microwave dinner which is disappointing. The staff at the reception told us to turn left when we walked out of the hotel and and then turn left again at the next turn and then turn right. We were a bit unsure walking down the slope with all private houses and cars around. But true enough, there is a family restaurant in the middle of nowhere and it is about 10 mins walk from the hotel They were many families there. Very inconvenience and bad location.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid if you want easy access to Rome city centre”
Reviews.Author: mezperth
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the end of a coach tour and made the mistake of booking 2 extra nights here. The hotel itself is fine - comfy beds, good size rooms, bathroom ok (shower broke on friday night but was fixed on saturday morning), its a nice residential area. To get to the centre of Rome you need to catch a bus, then a tram. It only costs 1 euro and we waited 15 minutes for the bus on a sunday. It took us 30 min to get to Piazza del Popolo. We ended up catching a taxi back at the end of the day and it cost 14 euro. The next day the public transport was on strike so no buses! The real problem is there is no food available at the hotel at night. they offer "microwave meals" and the closest restaurant is at least a 20 min walk away (down a BIG hill). We had the bad luck of being there on a Sunday night so had to walk even further and the only option was a steakhouse another 10 min down the road. It is a real pain after a full day of sightseeing in Rome. Needless to say the other nights we stayed in the city centre for our dinner! We would not stay here again as it is just too inconvenient to travel to the city centre each day, better to stay closer and make it easy on yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Busy Road”
Reviews.Author: Gorgran
Reviews.Content: This is a small Hotel on the outskirts of Rome. It is situated in Gardens off a very busy road. We stayed only 1 night before our trip home. We walked down the busy road to try and find a restaurant but everything was closed (Sunday) Fortunately we met other people from our tour who had been given instructions by the Hotel receptionist on how to find a restaurant that was open. We had to walk down another very busy road to find it. about 15 minutes walk (Nice meal though) Hotel meals were described by an American as T.V. Dinners. Average size room nice and clean and comfortable bed. Staff seemed pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but far from everything”
Reviews.Author: mistok72
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good hotel, in a really quiet and beautiful place in Rome. The negative aspect is that it's far from whatever you could think to visit in Rome; Ponte Milvio, the closest tourist attraction is more than 2 km away. Moreover the public transportation in the area is not good: there's only a small bus in front of the hotel entrance, with long delay to be expected. Inside the hotel is instead very clean and quite comfortable, especially if you are lucky and are not assigned the really too small room that happened to me. There was not either a chair to sit at the table and work, just the bed and the bathroom. Breakfast is not expensive but neither very good, in particular for not italian tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Not as expected”
Reviews.Author: DVassallo
Reviews.Content: Incredibly small rooms, with an ok bathroom. Location is very far from the centre: two buses from city centre (about 40 minutes). Breakfast acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel room, but poor location”
Reviews.Author: azwells
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving in Rome (our honeymoon), we got the train to the main station, thinking our hotel wouldn't be too far, however it took approx 30 mins! Which wasn't a problem in the scheme of things. Getting to and from the hotel was a bit of a hassle, as it is located in a residential area in Monte Mario; meaning we had to catch 2 buses to get to any of the sites. Again, we got over that problem. My advice is that if you don't want the hassle of waiting for buses, choose a hotel which is close to the underground stations - we found Line A to be particularly good at getting around everywhere. Moving onto the hotel. The food wasn't that great, but the the lady who works in the restaurant was very friendly. The room was comfortable, clean, tidy and spacious. It seemed this hotel would suit business travellers rather than leisure, as there was no atmosphere during the evening, sometimes the bar didn't even open! One of the receptionists was quite ignorant and seemed unhelpful. This may have just been his personality.

Reviews.Title: “Great place so so hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelbabe2008
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for four nights I think, on a bed and breakfast basis. The hotel is great, lovely accomodation, clean and modern but the food is extremely poor and really let it down. We were lucky to actually eat breakfast as it was very limited, fruit was mouldy, bread stale what more can I say. Evening food was a no no too, they only served microwave meals and it was a very limited choice!!! The hotel is out of town by quite a few miles, however we didn't find getting about and into the centre of Rome a problem. The hotel staff helped us with directions and details of which buses/trams to take and the transport was cheap and frequent. Food in Rome was good value for money, didn't find it expensive at all. The weather exceeded my expectations - I never knew italy could be so hot so if you are going in August make sure you stock up on suntan lotion and water. As the hotel is a little out of town we either ate whilst in central Rome or had to get a bus back into the local area to eat which sometimes was the last thing you wanted to do but bar facilites were not good so staying at the hotel in the evening wasn't really an option (unless like us you had to get an early night as you were totally knackered from walking around Rome) We did a day trip to naples and pompeii, which is definitely worth doing, the hotel had details of many guided tours which this was one of them. It was well organised through a separate company, Green line tours I think it was called. People say that Rome is romantic, I didn't feel that way. It was hot, tiring but the actual place was amazing. I would def recommend going to Rome but would also recommend that you pay a bit extra to stay somewhere closer to the centre of town.

Reviews.Title: “don't go!”
Reviews.Author: lou&drew
Reviews.Content: We are working people and don't get many holidays at all,(one a year if we are lucky as have own business) so when we do, we need everything on tap as such, so we can relax and enjoy a bit of luxury! Got holiday deal at very good price, but looking back, would have definately paid more for a better hotel. This hotel would be okay if you are after a budget hotel at a bargain price, but even saying that, I think that stating 'budget' is being a bit generous. If you are the type of person who would leave a hotel early morning, return late evening, want a clean room, not bothered about extra comforts/decor, then here maybe okay for you, but you would still need earplugs (see below!) We, would not stay here again. Must say hotel and the room was very clean (daily clean) but very, very basic no coffee making facilities in room etc. The room we stayed in had two twin beds (asked for double, arrived early hours exhausted, didn't have energy to ask them to change it! we simply pushed beds together or I did, so I could still sort his snoring out!!!!) a wardrobe, a table, a phone, a television(tv, only English channels were two news stations, but we are in Rome!) and thats it. There is not a bar in the hotel as they state! It is a hole in the wall, with a few bottles on a ledge!! Extremely, very noisy hotel, we bought ear plugs so we could sleep!! Without ear plugs, we wouldn't have had any choice but being able to go to sleep after about 1 am in the morning! Ear plugs are now an essential part of our travel pack, just in case!! You will have to catch a bus and then a tram to get to the city centre, which takes about 15 mins to get there (based upon setting off at about 9.30am - 10am), but coming back (4pm ish plus) it will take up to an hour. Hotel situated in domestic area, so there isn't any evening entertainment places within walking distance from hotel. After a full days walking site seeing, would have been nice to just have a little wander in the evening to restaurants etc but you would have to get a bus to get to any. In our opinion, it would be worth paying more to stay in a better hotel and in one which is nearer to Rome centre, so you have easy access for evening entertainment. Wouldn't stay here again. Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Far from the city center”
Reviews.Author: lb5569
Reviews.Content: Prior to our arrival we called for directions, only to be told they were overbooked and we'd be staying at another hotel for the first night. Villa Maria did pick up our luggage and upgraded the room when we got there. The bus route outside the hotel doesn't go directly to any of the sights. You must transfer to a tram, metro or another bus. The website said "close to the Vatican". It took nearly 45 minutes and two buses to get there. Breakfast was not impressive compared to the other hotels we stayed at. We learned dinner was only served when a group was staying at the hotel. After being told dinner was being served one night, we found it wasn't when we went to eat. I inquired about delivery from somewhere else, since the hotel is located in a quiet, residential area. Not possible. The staff made no effort to try and help us get dinner. However, the biggest complaint we had was the hot water. Or, should I say lack of in the morning. The room was clean. There's a nice terrace on the upper level. But, unless you're with a tour group, I would stay elsewhere. The staff could also do better. I would rather have paid more Euros, and stayed closer to the center of the city. It was too much of a hassle to return to the hotel, and go back into the city.

Reviews.Title: “didnt like”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: we arrived at the airport at 5pm only to find out that there were no buses to the hotel we had to catch a taxi paying 50 euro to get us to the hotel which took almost a hour to get there, on arriving at the hotel we were hungry, only to be told that there were no resturant faciltes available, we had to walk for 1/2 hour to find somewhere, the hotel was full of young student running around and playing music loudly most the night, complainted to the desk. It is a long way from the centre, had to catch a bus then the metro, taking over 1 hours, renovation work being done, not very helpful staff, would not recommond this hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Nice but out of the way.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No problems at all. Helpful staff, nice beds and food. Its miles from the centre of town...you have to get two buses to the centre or one bus and a tram to the Piaza del Popolo. If you enjoy walking then by all means this is for you. A nice up and coming area with alot of wine bars and some nice resaurants about a mile from the hotel and a decent market on saturdays! Round the corner from that is a swimming baths and the Olympic Stadium. Be warned...if you have an early morning flight home this hotel is on the total opposite side of the city from both airports!

Reviews.Title: “Miles from the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of the "Close to the Vatican" hook and we wanted to be "close". The map wasn't helpful, not clear about location. Thought "close" implied within walking distance, it's NOT. It's MILES from the Vatican. Felt that was deceptive marketing. It's really far from the historic Roman sites we wanted to see. It was cheap but more than made up the difference in cabfare/busfare (took more time) than if we'd booked something more central @ a higher rate.

HotelInfo.Name: Villa Maria Regina
HotelInfo.Address: Via Della Camilluccia 687, 00135 Rome, Italy
